mods:name.mods:namePart: Community Service Society of New York

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Tenement House Where Work is Carried On On Women's Wear

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Annotation on back: (1) In April 1, 1905, Charities (Vol. XIV), following p. 625. Article at p. 624, by Annie S. Daniel, entitled "The Wreck of Home; How Wearing Apparel is Fashioned in the Tenements." Caption: A Tenement-house Where Work is Carried On On Women's Wear." Photographer not credited. (2) In March 4, 1911, The Survey page 927. (Vol. XXV) Article at p. 927, by Johanna Von Wagner entitled "The Housing Awakening, VII, Teaching the Tenant." Caption: Why Teaching the Tenant is Needed."

Description: (Negative on file and one duplicate) #350 Unknown Photographer In April 1, 1905, Charities, following page 625. (Vol. XIV) Article at p. 624, by Annie S. Daniel, entitled “The Wreck of the Home; How Wearing Apparel is Fashioned in the Tenements.” Caption: “A Tenement-house Where Work is Carried On On Women’s Wear.” In March 4, 1911, The Survey page 927. (Vol. XXV) Article at p. 927, by Johanna Von Wagner entitled “The Housing Awakening, VII, Teaching the Tenant.” Caption: “Why Teaching the Tenant is Needed.”

mods:relatedItem.mods:note: Annie Daniel, "The Wreck of the Home; How Wearing Apparel is Fashioned in the Tenement." Charities 14 (1905): 625; Johanna Von Wagner, "The Housing Awakening, VII, Teaching the Tenant." The Survey 25 (1911): 927.

mods:location.mods:physicalLocation: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University
